Description: Pottery sherd from cup. Dark lustrous slip inside and out, with added red and white paint on the outside.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Probably made at Knossos, Crete. Fitton, J.L., Hughes, M. and Quirke, S. (1998), ‘Northerners at Lahun: Neutron Activation Analysis of Minoan and related pottery in the British Museum’, in S. Quirke (ed.) Lahun Studies, p. 118
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (A559)
Kemp & Merrillees 1980 / Minoan Pottery in Second Millennium Egypt (Ka.17) (p. 67)
